meta.title: Hacker Days - Prototyping the future of rural areas, in community
meta.description: One week. One real challenge. One change for many villages. Hacker Days is an initiative to prototype the future of rural areas, in community.

hero.title: Hacker Days: prototyping the future of rural areas, in community.
hero.subtitle: One week to contribute your talent and solve a real challenge that can improve the lives of more than 1500 villages.

why.title: Why was Hacker Days born?
why.intro1: Sometimes in rural areas, projects take time to reach the end. But when we come together, something changes.
why.intro2: Hacker Days was born with the idea of solving real challenges in just one week, demonstrating that by each person contributing a little, we can build solutions that help an entire community.
why.story: Each edition will address a new challenge that emerges from the village, from its protagonists.
why.storyHighlight: This year, the challenge comes from Rosabel and Olga, two women over 60 who have been managing their village's community water system for years.
why.imageAlt: Olga and Rosabel, caretakers of Anceu's community water

challenge.title: The 2025 Challenge: Automate collective water management
challenge.subtitle: What if we could improve the lives of people who take care of your village's water?
challenge.description1: Rosabel and Olga are two neighbors from the village of Anceu. They are in charge of water management. We don't have a distribution company. They are part of the Anceu Water Community board. They read 400 water meters a year, house by house every 3 months. They detect leaks, organize billing, do follow-up.
challenge.question: What will happen when they are no longer here?
challenge.description2: Today, we pay ‚Ç¨80 a year thanks to their selfless work. If community management is lost, the price will go up again for all people in the village.
challenge.highlight: What if we create an open source solution replicable in 1500 villages that facilitates continuing this collective water management system?

goals.title: We want:
items: For village people to have a better quality of life.
For the village to maintain collective water management.
For you to come help us design it.

challenge.imageAlt: Village women managing a community resource
challenge.imageCaption: Olga and Rosabel, caretakers of Anceu village's community water

participants.title: Who are we looking for?
participants.subtitle: We need diverse talent to address this challenge from different perspectives.
participants.subtitle2: If you identify with any of these profiles, we want to count on you!
participants.cta: I want to contribute my talent

profiles.title: Engineering
profiles.description: To design and implement a web with authentication, resource management, and notifications.

profiles.title: Design
profiles.description: To show the complex in a simple way and create intuitive interfaces for people with different digital levels.

profiles.title: UX/UI
profiles.description: To improve the user experience and ensure the solution is accessible for all age ranges.

profiles.title: Communication
profiles.description: To document what we do and replicate the model in the 1500 villages that manage water communally.

profiles.title: Digitalization
profiles.description: To teach those who will use it and facilitate generational change in collective water management.

profiles.title: Mediation
profiles.description: To listen, understand and connect with rural reality and the needs derived from collective water management.

program.title: The program - One week to change many things
program.subtitle: From September 1 to 7, 2025, we will live an intense week of collaboration, learning and creation in Anceu, Galicia.

days.title: Immersion in the village
days.description: We will meet Olga and Rosabel to thoroughly understand the water management needs. We will map current processes and define objectives.

days.title: Design and prototype creation
days.description: We will work in multidisciplinary teams to design and begin building a solution that is simple, robust and adapted to real needs.

days.title: Testing, improvements and testing
days.description: We will test the prototype with the village, collect feedback and make improvements to ensure the solution is viable and useful.

days.title: Celebration and presentation
days.description: We will celebrate the week's achievements and present the prototype to other water communities, sharing learning and expanding impact. The prototype will remain operational in Anceu for validation.

impact.title: What changes if you participate or support?
impact.subtitle: One week of your talent can mean years of autonomy and community for many people.

impacts.title: Changes the lives of Rosabel and Olga
impacts.description: We facilitate their essential work and ensure their effort has continuity.

impacts.title: Changes the future of 1500 villages
impacts.description: A replicable solution that can help hundreds of communities with the same challenge.

impacts.title: Changes your way of understanding the rural
impacts.description: A transformative experience that will connect you with life in the village.

items.title: Free participation
items.description: Participation in Hacker Days is completely free.

items.title: Accommodation included
items.description: The stay will be at Anceu Coliving, a shared space for 14 people, surrounded by nature and designed for collaboration.

items.title: Meals included
items.description: Meals are included throughout the week.

items.title: Transport
items.description: Transport to Anceu is not covered, each participant must manage it on their own.

items.title: Work spaces
items.description: The challenge will be developed between Anceu Coliving and the Casa del Pueblo Vecinal, connecting the spaces of life, creation and community.

about.title: Who we are - Rural Hackers
about.description1: We are a non-profit organization born in Galicia to use technology and community as tools against rural depopulation.
about.description2: We organize residencies, hackathons, intergenerational events and European projects.
about.description3: This is just one more step to demonstrate that rural areas also innovate.
